Key Arguments: The government should not decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The proposed legislation is seen as an expansion of government control and is considered undemocratic.
The government has shown incompetence and neglect in adhering to constitutional and international rights.
Past government actions during the COVID-19 pandemic demonstrate a lack of trustworthiness and poor decision-making.
Main Themes: Criticism of government handling of COVID-19
Notable Quotes: Once a government is committed to the principle of silencing the voice of opposition, it has only one way to go, and that is down the path of increasingly repressive measures, until it becomes a source of terror to all its citizens and creates a country where everyone lives in fear.
I do not support tightening of Government control over the population and restriction of ideas.
